Chapter Six

Tucker stretched and tried to get comfortable. They’d been driving for hours and his legs and back were beginning to get stiff. The wolves certainly seemed tireless, only stopping for gas and food or to switch drivers. By the time they began climbing into the mountains, it was well after midnight.

Christian, the current driver, pulled right up to the front door by means of a semi-circular driveway before stopping. Gavin got out right away and went to the back to pull out his and Tucker’s suitcases. He motioned for Tucker to follow him and went through the big double doors into the lodge.
